note.p: Death: Grayshott House, Haslemere, Surrey (17 January 1911)
Burial: The family vault at Claverdon, near Warwick, Warwickshire
Research Field: Statistics, anthropometry, experimental psychology, heredity
Medals/Prizes: Royal Medal 1886; Darwin Medal 1902; Copley Medal 1910
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series B 1911-1912 vol 84 pp x-xvii signed by G H D
References: Roy S Porter, 'Medical futures' (The Wilkins Lecture 2000) in NR 2001 vol 55 pp 325-329
David C Watt, 'Lionel Penrose, FRS (1898-1972) and Eugenics: Part One' in NR 1998 vol 52 pp 137-151
David C Watt, 'Lionel Penrose, FRS (1898-1972) and Eugenics. Part Two' in NR 1998 vol 52 pp 339-354
John Postgate, 'Eugenics Revisited', review of Milo Keynes, ed, Sir Francis Galton, FRS - The Legacy of his Ideas in NR 1994 vol 48 pp 143-146
A W F Edwards, 'From African exploration to the birth of eugenics. A life of Sir Francis Galton: from African exploration to the birth of eugenics, by N W Gillham' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 399-400
R A Crowther, 'Viruses and the development of quantitative biological electron microscopy' in NR 2004 vol 58 pp 65-81
Notes: Richard Partridge has signed twice, under both General and Personal Knowledge; Charles Darwin has signed twice under Personal Knowledge, once using 'Charles', once with 'C'
